meanings.definition: To increase or accumulate rapidly and progressively.
meanings.sent1: The number of toys in the box pyramided as more were added.
meanings.sent2: She pyramided her savings by consistently putting aside a portion of her income.
meanings.sent3: The cookies on the plate pyramided so high that they almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: His excitement pyramided as he got closer to meeting his favorite celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room pyramided until it was almost unbearable.

meanings.definition: To arrange or build in the shape of a pyramid.
meanings.sent1: He carefully pyramided the blocks to create a stable structure.
meanings.sent2: The cheerleaders pyramided during the halftime show.
meanings.sent3: The chef pyramided the fruit slices on the platter for an elegant presentation.
meanings.sent4: The cards were pyramided neatly on the table for the magic trick.
meanings.sent5: The dancers pyramided on stage, creating a stunning visual effect.
